title: OUC Viewing Party Competition
body:
Hey everyone,

We just announced the [Oceanic University Championship](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/esports/esports-event/oceanic-university-championship-coming), a tournament for all University players in OCE. The grand finals of this tournament will be held live in Riot Studios in Sydney with the top two teams getting flown over to play! We want to know which university YOU would like to have a viewing party for the grand finals. The university with the most votes will have a viewing party on campus for the Grand Finals with support from Razer.

So head on over and [vote now ](http://goo.gl/forms/QkVOHNrTJm)

Voting closes on August 15th 12:00 pm

* Must be a university in Oceania
* The university cannot be in the same city as the university that has the most teams sign up

**EDIT** 
I will update how the voting is going every Friday until the 15th of August

**Current top 10 as at 14/08/2015**
1. University of Wollongong - 168
2. RMIT - 134
3. Queensland University of Technology - 117
4. University of New South Wales - 80
5. University of Newcastle
6. University of Otago
7. University of Queensland
8. Victoria University of Wellington
9. Macquarie University
10. Monash university

hey @Marauder Im currently looking after Flinders University lol club which is one of South Australias largest Universities. 
Currently it is a struggle to grow as we need a large number of members to get affiliated and without affiliation we cannot attend actual Uni events or advertise....
So growth is difficult. 
Currently we have 3 teams who want to play for fun which includes our 1 team that is training for OUC. 
This brings me to the question: could riot assist with the recruitment process as we are all connected through the Riot client and this would allow us to find each other easier and build a stronger network faster.

We are always looking for ways to help our players out. What kind of ideas did you have in mind?

Also are you apart of this [group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/FlindersLoL/)?

A good way to grow your club is also to have a chat with all the other University club admins and see how they are growing and what they are doing.

Hey yeh

The chairman just quit from stress, so currently I am sort of managing it but its very hard. 
The hardest part is finding students that play league.
I think if their was like an official IGN that could be used for university team managers and then put through the client I could recruit to our facebook group easier and the club would grow easily. 
Currently we have 70 people but we need like 100 or more to get uni finding and become affiliated by the Uni as a real club. 
As a uni of 50,000+ students there must be loads of us. 

So ideas I had was an official ign managment name that I can use in client for chat and players can find it via the client to add me and I can direct them to the Flinders University facebook page where we do most of our organisation. 
This way I dont have to do so much searching in the dark.
Oh Cool thanks for the quick update Marauder!
